info.title: GRUD API
info.description: a restful service for storing data in tables

post.description: Creates a new temporary file handle.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: file to add to the system

folder.description: parent folder id, if null parent folder is root folder

get.description: Returns meta-information about a file.
Retrieve all rows of tables that link to this file.

put.description: Uploads/replaces a language specific file for this file handle.

get.description: Gets a language specific file for this file handle.

400.description: If a width is specified and the mimeType of the source file is not supported for resizing, this error is thrown.

get.description: Returns the root folder. Has no ID because it can't be changed or deleted.

parameters.name: langtag
parameters.description: The langtag which specifies which language name filed should be used for sorting the files

get.description: Returns a specific folder. Hierarchy is not relevant.

parameters.name: langtag
parameters.description: The langtag which specifies which language name filed should be used for sorting the files

post.description: Resets whole schema and re-initialize system tables
Creates two demo tables (Bundesl√§nder, Regierungsbezirke) with links.

get.description: Returns an array containing all available services with their metadata.
Returns the metadata of a service.

patch.description: Changes the service and returns its current metadata.

delete.description: Drops the complete service and deletes its definition.

get.description: Returns an array containing all available annotation configs.
Returns the config of an annotation.

delete.description: Deletes the config of an annotation.

post.description: Updates schema of system tables. To get the nonce, take a look at the backend logs.

post.summary: Create a complete table with columns and rows

get.description: Returns an array containing all available tables with their metadata.
Returns the metadata of a table.

delete.description: Drops the complete table and deletes its definition.

get.description: Returns all columns of specific table

post.description: Alters the user table and add the column definition to the system table.

200.description: The definition of the new column

get.description: Returns information about a specific column.

delete.description: Deletes column from user table and table definition.

get.description: Returns the value of a specified cell.

post.summary: DEPRECATED - Update cell or add link/attachment
post.description: DEPRECATED: Use same route with PATCH instead. Updates the value of specified cell. This can add links, attachments, multi-language contents and replaces simple values such as numbers, booleans or strings.

patch.description: Updates the value of specified cell. This can add links, attachments, multi-language contents and replaces simple values such as numbers, booleans or strings.

put.description: Replace the current value of the specified cell. This overwrites all languages in a multi-language cell or deletes all links and replaces the data with the provided value.

delete.description: Clears the set cell value and reset it to its default value.

get.summary: Retrieves the history entries of a table
get.description: Returns the history entries of a table.

get.summary: Retrieves the history entries of a table
get.description: Returns the history entries of a table.

get.summary: Retrieves the history entries of a row
get.description: Returns the history entries of a row.

get.summary: Retrieves the history entries of a row
get.description: Returns the history entries of a row.

get.summary: Retrieves the history entries of a cell
get.description: Returns the history entries of a specified cell.

get.summary: Retrieves the history entries of a cell
get.description: Returns the history entries of a specified cell.

get.summary: Retrieves the history entries of a cell
get.description: Returns the history entries of a specified cell.

get.summary: Retrieves the history entries of a cell
get.description: Returns the history entries of a specified cell.
Returns just the rows of the table

post.description: Adds new row to user table.

get.description: Returns a single row and its values.

delete.description: Deletes a row from user table. Optionally, all rows associated with this row can be replaced by a another rowId provided via query parameter `replacingRowId`

patch.description: Update the cells of the given columns in the row

put.description: Replaces the values of cells of the given columns in the row

parameters.name: skipConstrainedLinks
parameters.description: When true, do not duplicate links with `n:x` cardinality where `n < ‚àû`.

parameters.name: annotateSkipped
parameters.description: When true, annotate all columns which were not duplicated as "Please double check".

parameters.name: Columns to duplicate
parameters.description: When given, duplicate only those columns. Query parameter `skipConstrainedLinks` dominates given columns.

post.description: Duplicates a row with the same values and returns the duplicated row.

get.description: Retrieve all rows of tables that link to this row.

patch.description: Adds new annotations to this row.

patch.summary: Add annotations to all rows of a table.
patch.description: Adds new annotations to all rows of a table.

get.summary: Get all rows of a specific column
get.description: Returns just the rows of the specified column of the table

get.summary: Get all unique values of a specific column
get.description:
Returns just the unique values of the specified column. Implemented only for column kind `shorttext`. 

**Note:** This endpoint always returns a flat list of strings. If the column is of languageType `language` the optional query parameter `languageTag` has to be provided to filter the values for a specific language.

200.description: All unique values of the column

get.summary: Get all unique values of a specific column
get.description:
Returns just the unique values of the specified column. Implemented only for column kind `shorttext`. 

**Note:** This endpoint always returns a flat list of strings. If the column is of languageType `language`, the optional query parameter `languageTag` has to be provided to filter the values for a specific language.

200.description: All unique values of the column

get.summary: Get all rows of the first column
get.description: Returns just the rows of the first column of the table

delete.description: Removes a specified attachment from a cell.

delete.summary: Delete a link in a cell
delete.description: Removes a link from a cell.

put.summary: Changes the order of the link.
put.description: Changes the order of the links by reordering the specified link to the beginning, end or in front of another relative link.

get.summary: Get a list of foreign rows that can be linked to this cell.
get.description: Get a list of foreign rows that can be linked to this cell.

post.summary: Add an new annotation to a cell.
post.description: Adds an annotation to a cell. Annotations with the same type and value will be merged.

get.description: Get annotations of this cell

delete.summary: Remove an annotation from a cell.
delete.description: Removes an annotation for all language tags from a cell.

delete.summary: Remove annotation for a language from a cell.
delete.description: Removes an annotation for a specific language tag from a cell.

delete.summary: Delete all permissions of this row.

put.description: Replace current permissions of this row. This overwrites all permissions of this row with the new provided permission array.

get.description: Returns an array containing all user settings
Returns an array containing user settings of specific kind
Returns an array containing user settings for a specific table

delete.description: Delete user settings for a specific table

name.description: the name of the filter setting

CellValue.description: New cell value, depending on the type of the column.

displayName.description: display name of the annotation as multilang obj

totalSize.description: Total number of rows depending on filter query parameters. If no filters are set, totalSize is the total number of rows in the table

LanguageTag.description: A language tag in RFC 5646 format.

location.description: Sets the new order to be either the first (=start), the last (=end) or in front of another entity (=before).

id.description: If using "before", we need to provide the id of a relative entity, so the referenced entity can be put before this.

concatFormatPattern.description: Pattern for the frontend how to render the content of the concat column

name.description: An internal name that can be used in the Aggregator, for example.

identifier.description: A setting whether this column shows up in the ID column (used to show important information in links).

multilanguage.description: If the values of the cells are translatable or not, this is set to true. You need to check the languageType setting, whether to check for language or for country specific values.

ordering.description: A value to put the column in the correct order in the table.

languageType.description: The language type of the column. It can be single language (see "multilanguage" property), multilanguage (language) or multicountry (country).

toTable.description: The table it links to, if the column is of kind "link".

countryCodes.description: The possible country values if the languageType is set to "country".

Response:HistoryRows.description: All history entries that belongs to the request (filtered based on cell, row or table).

rows.description: An array with all history entries based on the request filter

author.description: Name of the user who has triggered a change

languageType.description: The language type of the column

revision.description: Identifier sequence of a history entry

rowId.description: The id of the row, could be empty, e.g. for row history entries

valueType.description: The type of the value. For cell changes this is the column type. In case of annotations it's the type of the flag or of the comment

Response:CellAnnotations.description: A List of annotations of a cell.

Response:Row.description: The complete row containing the values of the cells.

values.description: An array with all cells included. It is sorted by the current order of the columns of the table.

final.description: A flag describing whether the row is final or not.

Response:DependentRow.description: A row that links to a specified row.

Response:DependentRows.description: All rows that link to the specified row.

dependentRows.description: An array with all rows depending on the selected row

Response:FileDependentRow.description: A row that links to a file.

Response:FileDependentRows.description: All rows with column that link to a file.

dependentRows.description: An array with all rows depending on a file

Response:ForeignRows.description: An array with all linkable rows to the specified cell

rows.description: An array with all rows depending on the selected row

settings.description: An array with all user settings

Request:Folder.description: Creates a new folder. If parent is empty the folder will be created in the root folder.

items.description: ids of parent folders up to root folder (excluded)

parents.description: parent folders up to root folder (excluded)

Response: Folder.description: Complete folder with parents, subfolders and files.

Response: Unique Column Values.description: Unique values of a single column as flat string array.

columns.description: Array of columns (kind 'link' is not allowed)

Request: Create complete table.description: Creates a new table with columns and rows. If columns & rows are empty an empty table will be created.

description.en: This table holds a list of all states of germany
description.de: diese Tabelle beinhaltet alle Bundesl√§nder Deutschlands

ordering.description: A value to put the service in the correct order in the service list.

config.description: An object that represents the configuration of a service.

scope.description: An object that represents the scope of a service.

displayName.description: display name of the annotation as multilang obj

Response: Complete table.description: Complete table with columns and rows.

current.description: The current version of the database

specification.description: The version of the implementation - if this is higher, you need to update the current database

Shared Response: Table.description: Complete table with columns and rows.

toTable.description: Optional, only needed if kind is link.

toColumn.description: Optional, only needed if kind is link.

final.description: A flag describing whether the row is final or not. Only present if final is set to true.

archived.description: A flag describing whether the row is archived or not. Only present if archived is set to true.

Shared Response: Row.description: A row contains all column values of this specific table.

ordering.description: A value to put the service in the correct order in the service list.

config.description: An object that represents the configuration of a service.

scope.description: An object that represents the scope of a service.

Shared Request: Row.description: A row object, which is used to add a new row to a table, has only an array of values.

Multi-language object.description: A multi-language object is a key-value object for multi-language values. Keys a langtags (e.g. de-DE) and the values are the value of that object in the specific language.

Enum: HistoryType.description: The type of the history entry

Response: Basefolder.description: A subfolder returned in a request to folders

identifier.description: Flag if this column should be part of the concatenated identifier column.

name.description: An internal name that can be used to easily identify tables instead of using an id.

frontendReadOnly.description: Flag if values of this column can be changed from frontend.

groups.description: A list of column ids that should build a group column

formatPattern.description: Pattern for the frontend how to render the content of a group column

showMemberColumns.description: Flag if the member columns should be displayed in the frontend table view (They are always displayed in entity view).

minLength.description: Minimum length of the value, only for text columns

maxLength.description: Maximum length of the value, only for text columns

decimalDigits.description: Number of decimal digits, only for numeric columns. Values between 0 and 10 are allowed. If not set, the default value is 3.

Shared Request: Column.description: A column object, which is used to create a new column.

description.en: a group example, the column ids in groups array must be absolute

tableId.name: tableId
tableId.description: The id of the table to select.

serviceId.name: serviceId
serviceId.description: The id of the service to select.

columnId.name: columnId
columnId.description: The id of the column to select.

columnIds.name: columnIds
columnIds.description: Comma separated list of column ids

columnNames.name: columnNames
columnNames.description: Comma separated list of column names

rowId.name: rowId
rowId.description: The id of the row to select.

attachmentId.name: attachmentId
attachmentId.description: The UUID of the attachment to select.

annotationId.name: annotationId
annotationId.description: The UUID of the annotation to select.

languageTag.name: languageTag
languageTag.description: A language tag in RFC 5646 format.

languageTagOpt.name: languageTag
languageTagOpt.description: A language tag in RFC 5646 format.

langtags.name: langtags
langtags.description: An array of language tags in RFC 5646 format.

linkId.name: linkId
linkId.description: The id of the linked entity to select.

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the cell.

forceHistoryOpt.name: forceHistory
forceHistoryOpt.description: If set to true, a history entry will be created even if the value did not change.

nonce.name: nonce
nonce.description: nonce which will be exposed via server log

historyType.name: historyType
historyType.description: The type of the history to filter for.

groupId.name: groupId
groupId.description: The id of the group to select.

replacingRowId.name: replacingRowId
replacingRowId.description: The id of the row that should replace another row.

rowPermissionBody.name: value
rowPermissionBody.description: An array of row permission to add, remove or replace.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The maximum number of rows to return.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The number of rows to skip.

final.name: final
final.description:
Filter for final rows.
- If set to true, only final rows are returned.
- If set to false, only non-final rows are returned.
- If not set, all rows are returned. (default)

archived.name: archived
archived.description:
Filter for archived rows.
- If set to true, only archived rows are returned.
- If set to false, only non-archived rows are returned.
- If not set, all rows are returned. (default)

includeDeleted.name: includeDeleted
includeDeleted.description: Filter to include deleted entities. (default: false)

dependentRows.description: A list of rows that depend on a selected row

fileDependentRows.description: A list of rows with columns that depend on a file

foreignRows.description: A list of rows that can be linked to the specified row. If the cardinality check set is reached, the array is empty.

not-found-in-database.description: If the specified entity does not exist in the database, this error is thrown. For example a table, column or row with the specified id could not be found.

no-json-found.description: Request should have had a JSON body.

invalid-json-exception.description: Request contains an invalid JSON body.

database-exception.description: Server got a PostgreSQL error while running a statement
